citation.case_name: Puentes v. Board of Ed. of Union Free School Dist. No. 21
citation.docket_number: BOARD OF EDUCATION OF UNION FREE SCHOOL DISTRICT N

html_lawbox:
392 U.S. 653 (1968)

PUENTES
v.
BOARD OF EDUCATION OF UNION FREE SCHOOL DISTRICT NO. 21.

No. 562.

Supreme Court of United States.

Decided June 17, 1968.
APPEAL FROM THE COURT OF APPEALS OF NEW YORK.

Ernest Fleischman for appellant.

Leo F. McGinity for appellee.

PER CURIAM.

The judgment is vacated and the case is remanded to the Court of Appeals of New York for further consideration in light of Pickering v. Board of Education, 391 U. S. 563.

MR. JUSTICE BLACK and MR. JUSTICE DOUGLAS are of the opinion that the judgment should be reversed.

MR. JUSTICE HARLAN is of the opinion that probable jurisdiction should be noted and the case set for oral argument.

html:
392 U.S. 653

88 S.Ct. 2271

20 L.Ed.2d 1341

Robert PUENTES
v.

BOARD OF EDUCATION OF UNION FREE SCHOOL DISTRICT NO. 21.

No. 562.

Supreme Court of the United States

October Term, 1967.

June 17, 1968

Ernest Fleischman, for appellant.

Leo F. McGinity, for appellee.

PER CURIAM.

1

The judgment is vacated and the case is remanded to the Court of Appeals of New York for further consideration in light of Pickering v. Board of Education, 391 U.S. 563, 88 S.Ct. 1731, 20 L.Ed.2d 811.

2

Mr. Justice BLACK and Mr. Justice DOUGLAS are of the opinion that the judgment should be reversed.

3

Mr. Justice HARLAN is of the opinion that probable jurisdiction should be noted and the case set for oral argument.
